headline: In Senate Runs, Black Hopefuls  Delve Into Race
text: HORN LAKE, Miss. — Mike Espy and Jaime Harrison, two of the five Black Senate candidates in the South this year, may belong to different political generations, but they both came up in a Democratic Party where African-American politicians didn’t talk directly about race in campaigns against white opponents.
snippet: Several Black Democrats are running competitively in conservative states, and they are doing so by talking explicitly about race.
